93900.name: Gender Inequality Index (Human Development Report (2015))
93900.description: The GII is an inequality index. It shows the loss in potential human development due to disparity between female and male achievements in two dimensions, empowerment and economic status. The GII ranges between 0 and 1. Higher GII values indicate higher inequalities and thus higher loss to human development.
93900.datasetName: Gender Inequality Index - Human Development Report (2015)

source.name: Human Development Report (2015)
source.dataPublisherSource: Relies on data from the UN's MMEIG which includes WHO, UNICEF, UNFPA, and the World Bank as well as the UN Department of Economic and Social Affairs, UNESCO, IPU, ILO
source.additionalInfo: All observations for 1995 use 'share of seats in parliament' that refers to 1997.
